thread.title: U.S. Delegation Comments On Miller’s Legacy | Election 2012
thread.title_full: U.S. Delegation Comments On Miller’s Legacy | Election 2012

author: beforeitsnews.com
title: U.S. Delegation Comments On Miller’s Legacy | Election 2012
text:
(Before It's News)
Via Keloland
SIOUX FALLS, SD – Members of South Dakota’s national delegation are offering their condolences after the passing of former Governor Walter Dale Miller.
U.S. Senator Mike Rounds considered Miller a longtime friend and mentor.
“His love of South Dakota and legacy of public service is one we can all admire,” Rounds said. “Our thoughts and prayers will continue to be with the Millers.”
On Tuesday, U.S. Rep. Kristi Noem called Miller’s death is a tragedy.
“His counsel and encouragement served our state and its leaders for years after his official duties concluded. I personally appreciated his friendship and insight over the years. He will be sincerely missed,” Noem said.
U.S. Senator John Thune said former Gov. Miller served during a difficult time for South Dakota. Miller succeeded George S. Mickelson as governor after Mickelson and seven others died in a 1993 plane crash.
“Kimberley’s and my thoughts and prayers are with former Gov. Miller’s family and friends,” Thune said. “Thanks to his service, South Dakota is a better place. I consider it an honor and a privilege to have called him my friend during his long tenure of service to our state.”
Gov. Dennis Daugaard’s office announced Miller passed away on Monday night at age 89.
Brady Mallory is talking with those who knew Miller. Hear more about his legacy on KELOLAND News, and online on KELOLAND.com.
